BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: St Andrew's School Of Delaware Inc

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: St. Andrew's School is a coed boarding school, grades 9 through 12.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The School's mission is to provide secondary education of a definitely Christian character at a minimum cost consistent with modern equipment and highest standards. St. Andrew's School is a coed boarding school of students and faculty who live on a pristine 2,200-acre campus, learning together and collaborating to pursue their passions in academics, athletics, service, and the arts.
IRS990.Desc: The School is a coed boarding school, grades 9 through 12, providing a secondary education of a definitely Christian character in an entirely residential program. During fiscal year 15/16, the School enrolled 310 students & graduated 74, of whom all enrolled in college or university.

OtherSecuritiesGrp.Desc: HEDGE FUNDS AND PRIVATE EQUITY @ NAV

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: LIABILITY ON INTEREST RATE SWAP AGREEMENT

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The School's endowment fund supports scholarships and operation of the education program.

Line 2: The School has adopted the provisions of FASB ASC 740-10-50, Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes. Management continually evaluates uncertain tax positions and expiring statutes of limitations, audits, proposed settlements, changes in tax law and new authoritative rulings, as applicable. Management's evaluation is that there is no income tax liability. This evaluation is based on settled and established positions within the Internal Revenue Code and management believes there is no significant uncertainty related to its evaluation.
Endowment draw 7,275,861. School Store (net) 3,220. Endowment difference -8,110. Miscellaneous 1,357.
Auxiliary program income 9,441. Rodney Point income 350. Miscellaneous -15. Net fundraising events 76.
Endowment draw 7,275,861. Miscellaneous 1,357. Pension funding from endowment 322,000. School Store (net) 3,220. Endowment difference -8,110. Net fundraising events -76.
Rodney Point income 350. Auxiliary program income 9,441. Miscellaneous -15. Interest rate swap adjustment 54,521.
Admissions brochures; ADVIS (Association Of Delaware Valley Independent Schools) public information ad carried in numerous area newspapers
FMV
Scholarship assistance is provided on the basis of need and applicants are evaluated by the School's Financial Aid Committee against established criteria.
The School provides housing for the Headmaster as a condition of employment. He is considered to be a key and highly compensated employee and as such is listed on the Form 990, Part VII.
The Headmaster, Daniel T. Roach, Jr. is a participant in a nonqualified Section 457 Plan. The School made a contribution of $18,000 during the year ended 6/30/16.

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: Refinance Series 2004 Bonds & a portion of Series 2008 Bonds

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Issuer Name: New Castle County, Delaware Date the Rebate Computation was Performed: 06/30/2013
The School uses a brokerage account with an unrelated financial institution to process non-cash contributions of stock.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Some Trustees have a common family relationship.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990 is reviewed by the CFO, the Chair of Finance Committee and the Board Chair. It is then made available to all Board Members prior to filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Trustees are required to annually sign conflict of interest statements and disclose any known or potential conflicts of interest in these statements.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: St. Andrew's School's Trustees are all independent of the School's paid employees. Annually, the Trustees will make compensation decisions for its employees with no input from the employees themselves. Employees are not present when votes on compensation decisions are held and those votes are formally documented in the meeting minutes within one week of the meeting. The Trustees' decisions are based on their extensive knowledge and experience with compensation practices of other comparable organizations.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: There currently exists no legal requirement to make governing documents, conflict of interest policies or audited financial statements publicly available. St. Andrew's School of DE, Inc. has never received a request for information of this type. If any requests for this information should be received, they would be evaluated by the Trustees on a case by case basis. In general, the Trustees believe that the information available on this form (the 2015 Form 990) would be more than sufficient to respond to most legitimate inquiries.
Interest rate swap adjustment 54,521. Pension funding from endowment -322,000.
The School has an Audit & Finance Committee that assumes responsibility for oversight of the financial statement audit and the selection of the independent auditors.
